ygData.subject: Re: Skill gain
ygData.msgSnippet: There are File Molds in the Wood Elf city also. The merchant is  in a building on the platform just before the platform with TrueShot bows on it (it also has a
ygData.messageBody:
There are File Molds in the Wood Elf city also.

The merchant is in a building on the platform just before the platform with
TrueShot bows on it (it also has a Pottery Firing oven there too). I found
him by accident... :)

I have moved my operations to Freeport now. Just got bound there today.
Will continue to practice tailoring and blacksmithing here for a long time I
think.

Ailenu
Rallos Zek


-----Original Message-----
From: TSNFrodos@... [mailto:TSNFrodos@...]
Sent: Tuesday, April 13, 1999 2:21 PM
To: EQ_Blacksmiths@onelist.com
Subject: [EQ_Blacksmiths] Re: Skill gain


From: TSNFrodos@...

so far i have it form a more skilled blacksmith that lantern molds have
given
him better skill gain in the 40s range than skewers.. skewers might got some

reason be tougher (who knows for sure...)

good info on the Freeport vs Akanon pricing... not sure how to improve
faction with gnome merchants other than doing quests...

i was informed that studs require a file mold (found in freeport or just
outside kaladim gates) and metal bits to make a file then put metal bits and

file together to get stud... it was mentioned that a skill of around 40 to
50
would give good results on stud making...

a skill of around 60 to 80 starts giving good results on making banded
armor...

still no confirmation on if you really can make plate.. but i was wondering
just exactly what a folded metal sheet is for? <evil grin>
